remarks: Lemma for ~ prmrec .  Here we show the inequality ` N / 2 < # M ` by decomposing the set ` ( 1 ... N ) ` into the disjoint union of the set ` M ` of those numbers that are not divisible by any "large" primes (above ` K ` ) and the indexed union over ` K < k ` of the numbers ` W `` k ` that divide the prime ` k ` .  By ~ prmreclem4 the second of these has size less than ` N ` times the prime reciprocal series, which is less than ` 1 / 2 ` by assumption, we find that the complementary part ` M ` must be at least ` N / 2 ` large. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 6-Aug-2014.)
